result.execSummary:
The defendant Jonathan Diante Lawson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Misappropriate ID Info - Obtain Money, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.201(2)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
- Pay all costs, fees and surcharges during period of probation.  If unpaid a civil judgment will be ordered filed against the defendant.

Defendant shall provide a DNA sample for the Data Bank.
- Full time work, school or a combination.
Court will grant expungement upon successful completion of probation.

- Alcohol and drug assessment and comply with any treatment deemed necessary by the department.
- Maintain absolute sobriety.

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Jonathan Diante Lawson in court with attorney Christopher Paul Ehrfurth.  Defendant Jonathan Diante Lawson in custody.  Patrick J Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.    

Defendant ordered to serve 12 months in the House of Correction, concurrent to 2015CF934 with credit of 224 days time served.  Court STAYED the sentence and placed the defendant on probation for 2 years with the following conditions:

- Alcohol and drug assessment and comply with any treatment deemed necessary by the department.
- Maintain absolute sobriety. 
- Full time work, school or a combination.
- Perform 100 hours of community service.
- Pay all costs, fees and surcharges during period of probation.  If unpaid a civil judgment will be ordered filed against the defendant.

Defendant shall provide a DNA sample for the Data Bank. 

Court will grant expungement upon successful completion of probation. 

filed:  Pretrial Incarceration Credit

Defendant Jonathan Diante Lawson in court with attorney Christopher Paul Ehrfurth.  Defendant Jonathan Diante Lawson in custody.  Patrick J. Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case scheduled for final pretrial conference.  Parties have reached a resolution.    

Defendant changes plea to GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty. Court found that defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights. Plea questionnaire received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty as charged in the criminal complaint and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.  Defendant further advised that if he/she is not a US citizen deportation is possible.

Case adjourned for sentencing in branch 10.  Court ordered Defendant REMANDED into custody of the Milwaukee County Sheriff's Office until sentencing.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for October 12, 2017 at 08:30 am.
Filed.  Notice of motion and motion to admit evidence of defendant's failure to appear in court with brief in support of motion.  Dated 10/9/2017.

Attorney Christopher Paul Ehrfurth in court, defendant Jonathan Diante Lawson not in court, in custody.  Patrick J Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Case scheduled for plea/sentencing hearing. Defense wishes to be heard as to bail.   Bail motion by defense argued and denied by the Court.  Defendant enters a SPEEDY TRIAL DEMAND. Case adjourned for final pretrial and jury trial to Branch 10.  Final pre-trial scheduled for October 10, 2017 at 01:30 pm.  Jury trial scheduled for November 27, 2017 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Christopher Paul Ehrfurth in court, defendant Jonathan Diante Lawson not in court, in custody.  Patrick J Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Defense requests a plea and sentencing date. Case adjourned to Branch 10.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for September 5, 2017 at 01:30 pm.

All parties are advised effective July 31, 2017 case will be reassigned to Honorable Judge Michelle Havas, Branch 10, in Room 313 of the Safety Building.  

Scheduling conference scheduled for August 21, 2017 at 01:30 pm.
Case is adjourned for return on bench warrant in Branch 37 on June 14, 2017 at 8:30 a.m. Parties notified.   Deputy Court Clerk: TC.

Attorney Vladimir M. Gorokhovsky in court.  Daniel j Gabler appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 
Defendant has two cases before the court.
Defense counsel has no explanation for defendant's non-appearance at today's scheduled plea hearing and requests stayed bench warrant.
State requests bench warrant be issued.

Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered a Bench Warrant to be issued.  Court ordered any bail posted to be forfeited.  State's motion for Judgment of Bond Forfeiture 30 days after notification from the Clerk of Circuit Court's Office is granted by the Court.  Court makes finding that there is a possible victim identifed, therefore, Court stays order of forfeiture with recompense to be determined at close of case.

Defendant Jonathan Diante Lawson not in court, defendant in custody.  Megan Patricia Carmody appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Matter was before this Court for status of counsel.  No appearances made.  Contact made with the public defenders office.  Defendant had private counsel, which withdraw on the previous court date.  Defendant was not E-formed and needs to have this done. Defendant Jonathan Diante Lawson in court.  Megan Patricia Carmody appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Attorney Goodrich appeared in Court this morning at approximately 11:20 a.m. stating that he had an appointment scheduled in West Bend this afternoon and wanted to reschedule his afternoon court appearance.  Attorney Goodrich was instructed to contact the Assistant District Attorney in this matter, as witnesses had been subpoenaed for today and this case also has a co-defendant that was scheduled for the afternoon calendar.  Case is called on the record at approximately 2:30 p.m.  Attorney Goodrich was not present.  Court ordered case adjourned for Preliminary Hearing in Branch PE.  State did have witness present for today's proceedings.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 10, 2015 at 08:30 am.Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 10, 2015 at 08:30 a.m.
